intro: Byrsanthes nivea, commonly known as the white-flowered byrsanthes, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth surface and a slight aromatic scent. Byrsanthes nivea typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions.
